text: Chaetopappa asteroides, called the tiny lazy daisy, or Arkansas leastdaisy, is a North American species of plants in the sunflower family. It is native to the southern Great Plains of the United States (Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, Louisiana, Missouri, Arkansas) and also to northeastern Mexico (Tamaulipas, Hidalgo).Flora of North America, Tiny lazy daisy, Chaetopappa asteroides (Nuttall) de Candolle Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map ;Varieties * Chaetopappa asteroides var. asteroides - most of species range * Chaetopappa asteroides var. grandis Shinners \- Río Grande Valley in Texas ==References== ==External links== *Missouri Plants: Chaetopappa asteroides *Image Archive of Central Texas Plants: Chaetopappa asteroides Category:Astereae Category:Flora of the Great Plains (North America) Category:Flora of Hidalgo (state) Category:Flora of Tamaulipas Category:Flora of the United States Category:Flora of the South-Central United States Category:Plants described in 1834 Category:Taxa named by Augustin Pyramus de Candolle Category:Taxa named by Thomas Nuttall
title: Chaetopappa asteroides
